config.name: validFeedbackIcon
config.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

config.name: lg
config.desc: colspan out of 12 for large computer-sized screens

config.name: accept
config.desc: use for file input only. (default empty)

config.name: xs
config.desc: colspan out of 12 for mobile-sized screens

config.name: hideMode
config.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

config.name: disableKeyFilter
config.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

config.name: xattr
config.desc: extra attributes to add to 'element' (used by builder to store stuff.)

config.name: disabled
config.desc: is it disabled

config.name: name
config.desc: name of the input

config.name: validator
config.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

config.name: autocomplete
config.desc: - default is new-password see: https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/input/form/label-and-name-inputs?hl=en

config.name: tooltip
config.desc: Text for the tooltip

config.name: regexText
config.desc: -- Depricated - use Invalid Text

config.name: allowDomMove
config.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

config.name: style
config.desc: any extra css

config.name: labelmd
config.desc: set the width of label (1-12)

config.name: value
config.desc: default value of the input

config.name: hasFeedback
config.desc: default true

config.name: actionMode
config.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

config.name: sm
config.desc: colspan out of 12 for tablet-sized screens

config.name: minLengthText
config.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

config.name: maxLengthText
config.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

config.name: listeners
container_method
config.desc: method to fetch parents container element (used by NavHeaderbar -  getHeaderChildContainer)

config.name: readOnly
config.desc: Specifies that the field should be read-only

config.name: indicatorpos
config.desc: default left

config.name: align
config.desc: Default left

config.name: wrap
config.desc: Specifies how the text in a text area is to be wrapped when submitted in a form

config.name: focusClass
config.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

config.name: size
config.desc: - (lg|sm) or leave empty..

config.name: labellg
config.desc: set the width of label (1-12)

config.name: rows
config.desc: Specifies the visible number of lines in a text area

config.name: labelxs
config.desc: set the width of label (1-12)

config.name: validateOnBlur
config.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

config.name: cls
config.desc: css class

config.name: inputType
config.desc: button | checkbox | email | file | hidden | image | number | password | radio | range | reset | search | submit | text

config.name: invalidClass
config.desc: DEPRICATED - code uses BS4 - is-valid / is-invalid

config.name: maskRe
config.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

config.name: validationEvent
config.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

config.name: vtype
config.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

config.name: fieldLabel
config.desc: - the label associated

config.name: can_build_overlaid
config.desc: True if element can be rebuild from a HTML page

config.name: cols
config.desc: Specifies the visible width of a text area

config.name: blankText
config.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

config.name: before
config.desc: - input group add on before

config.name: validationDelay
config.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

config.name: selectOnFocus
config.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

config.name: disableClass
config.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

config.name: invalidFeedbackIcon
config.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

config.name: visibilityEl
config.desc: What element to use for visibility (@see getVisibilityEl())

config.name: placeholder
config.desc: - placeholder to put in text.

config.name: dataId
config.desc: cutomer id

config.name: md
config.desc: colspan out of 12 for computer-sized screens

config.name: regex
config.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

config.name: labelWidth
config.desc: set the width of label

config.name: minLength
config.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

config.name: capture
config.desc: use for file input only. (default empty)

config.name: validClass
config.desc: DEPRICATED - code uses BS4 - is-valid / is-invalid

config.name: allowBlank
config.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

config.name: html
config.desc: text

config.name: forceFeedback
config.desc: Default false

config.name: labelsm
config.desc: set the width of label (1-12)

config.name: after
config.desc: - input group add on after

config.name: maxLength
config.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

config.name: invalidText
config.desc: The error text to display if {@link #validator} test fails during validation (defaults to "")

methods.name: inputEl
methods.desc: return the real textarea element.

methods.name: markInvalid
methods.desc: Mark this field as invalid

methods.name: markValid
methods.desc: Mark this field as valid

methods.name: clearInvalid
methods.desc: Clear any invalid styles/messages for this field

methods.name: validate
methods.desc: Validates the field value

methods.name: getRawValue
methods.desc: Returns the raw data value which may or may not be a valid, defined value.  To return a normalized value see {@link #getValue}.

methods.name: getName
methods.desc: Returns the name of the field

methods.name: reset
methods.desc: Resets the current field value to the originally loaded value and clears any validation messages

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Returns the normalized data value (undefined or emptyText will be returned as '').  To return the raw value see {@link #getRawValue}.

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc: Sets a data value into the field and validates it.  To set the value directly without validation see {@link #setRawValue}.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

methods.name: validateValue
methods.desc:
Validates a value according to the field's validation rules and marks the field as invalid
if the validation fails

methods.name: tooltipEl
methods.desc: Fetch the element to display the tooltip on.

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide a component - adds 'hidden' class

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show a component - removes 'hidden' class

methods.name: setVisibilityEl
methods.desc: Set the element that will be used to show or hide

methods.name: getVisibilityEl
methods.desc: Get the element that will be used to show or hide

methods.name: initEvents
methods.desc: Initialize Events for the element

methods.name: getChildContainer
methods.desc: Fetch the element to add children to

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns the id of this component.

methods.name: render
methods.desc: If this is a lazy rendering component, render it to its container element.

params.name: container
params.desc: (optional) The element this component should be rendered into. If it is being applied to existing markup, this should be left off.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM,
removing the component from its {@link Roo.Container} (if applicable) and unregistering it from {@link Roo.ComponentMgr}.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if this component is visible.

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Try to focus this component.

params.name: selectText
params.desc: True to also select the text in this component (if applicable)

methods.name: enable
methods.desc: Enable this component.

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc: Convenience function to hide or show this component by boolean.

params.name: visible
params.desc: True to show, false to hide

methods.name: disable
methods.desc: Disable this component.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the underlying {@link Roo.Element}.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: *change
events.desc: Fires just before the field blurs if the field value has changed.

events.name: *invalid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been marked as invalid.

events.name: *valid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been validated with no errors.

events.name: *blur
events.desc: Fires when this field loses input focus.

events.name: *specialkey
events.desc:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed.  You can check
{@link Roo.EventObject#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

events.name: *focus
events.desc: Fires when this field receives input focus.

events.name: *childrenrendered
events.desc: Fires when the children have been rendered..

events.name: *beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: *disable
events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.name: *render
events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: *destroy
events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.name: *hide
events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: *beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: *show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

events.name: *beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: *enable
events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: *beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.
